questions.text: Identify the procedure in this image ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) saline infusion sonography (SIS) display detailed endometrial cavity anatomy by distending the cavity with sterile saline SIS can also assist in some infertility investigations and aid viewing of the endometrial thickness it is poorly image because of uterine position or pathology.

questions.text: Identify the disease in ultrasonography?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Beadsonastring”sign.The echogenic Mural nodules shown here (arrows) within this tuboovarian abscess are thought to represent flattened and fibrotic endosalpingeal folds of the inflamed fallopian tube. ( Ref : Williams textbook of gynaecology/3rd edition/34 )

choices.text: Microscopic evaluation of a vaginal-secretion saline preparation
Release of volatile amines produced by anaerobic metabolism,
Determina- tion of the vaginal pH

questions.text: Identify the cells in the image ? Which is the pathognomonic feature to identify the disease
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Above image shows Photomicrograph of saline wet preparation reveals clue cells. Several of these squamous cells are heavily studded with bacteria. Clue cells are covered to the extent that cell borders are blurred and nuclei are not visible. These cells are seen in bacterial vaginitis Clinical diagnostic criteria is Amsel criteria which include: 1) microscopic evaluation o a vaginal-secretion saline preparation- identify clue cells (2) release of volatile amines produced by anaerobic metabolism- whiff test (3) determina- tion of the vaginal pH. clue cells and a positive whiff test result is pathogno- monic for BV , even in asymptomatic patients. ( Ref Williams textbook of gynaecology/3rd edition/51-2)

questions.text: Gene involved in pathogenesis of Disease are all except
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) MED12 and HMGA2 genes, and less commonly COL4A5-A6 or FH are involved in pathogensis of leiomyoma ( Ref Williams textbook of gynaecology/3rd edition/203 )

questions.text: Match the following
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) ( Ref Williams textbook of gynaecology/3rd edition/204 )

questions.text: Identify the contraceptive device .?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Microinsert used in the Essure Permanent Birth Control System. insertion of a device into the proximal Fallopian tubes via hysteroscopy. Essure Permanent Birth Control System consists o a microinsert made o a stainless steel inner coil that is enclosed in polyester fibers

questions.text: A 19-year-old woman wish to use this contraceptive method. This couple should be advised that the most common reason for failure (pregnancy or STD transmission) is which of the following?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Barrier methods (e.g., male and female condoms, cervical caps, vaginal diaphragms, and vaginal sponges) inhibit sperm entry into the uterus. While no barrier method provides protection from all STDs, the partial protection afforded by these methods means that any sexually active couple who are not known to be disease free and mutually monogamous should use condoms for their disease protection alone.

questions.text: A newly married girl is worried about starting a contraceptive method & she visit a gynaecologist and she counsel her that the method have many benefits but can rarely increase the risk of which of the following conditions?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) OCs regulate menses in anovulatory women, decrease dysmenorrhea, improve acne, decreased hirsutism from polycystic ovarian disease, and reduce menstrual bleeding and iron-deficiency anemia. OCs also reduce the risk of benign breast lesions (e.g., fibroadenomas and fibrocystic changes), benign and malignant ovarian tumors, endometrial carcinoma, and pelvic inflammatory disease. OCs increase the risk of hepatic adenoma, especially the mestranol-containing preparations. Estimated annual risk is 3 to 4 per 100,000 women. These benign tumors can rupture, causing severe intraperitoneal hemorrhage and may regress when the OCs are stopped.

questions.text: A 8 year old girl presented in Gynae OPD with precocious puberty, she had breast development ( Tanner 2) and no axillary or public hairs, patient is obese, Dwarf, she was investigated and her TSH was 852 , prolactin was 186, LH was 0.07 Usg scan showed a ovarian cyst in left ovary. MRI scan of sella revealed a Sellar mass of 1.7*1.6* 1.2 cm and radioiodine scan of thyroid reveal no functioning thyroid tissue in neck or chest What is your diagnosis ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Van Wyk-Grumbach syndrome (VWGS) is characterized by juvenile hypothyroidism, delayed bone age, and isosexual precocious puberty It is characterised by delayed bone age and multicystic ovaries. High circulating levels of TSH with prepubertal LH confirmed the diagnosis of VWGS. Tendency to manifest sexual precocity in VWGS may be directly related to the severity of the TSH elevation. High circulating levels of TSH acting directly on FSH receptors are the actual mediators of precocity.

choices.text: You will ask lady to undergo endometrial biopsy
You will take a PAP smear and prepare patient for cervical biopsy
You will assure her that nothing needs to be done
You will give her antibiotics and assure her

questions.text: A 48 year old perimenopausal women comes to your clinic with complain of foul smelling vaginal discharge with occasional complain of post coital bleeding, you do a per speculum examination and following findings are observed, how will you proceed next
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Image showing cervical nanothian cyst with symmetric, smooth, yellow or clear lesion on the ectocervix. During squamous metaplasia, squamous epithelium may cover functional glandular cells and secretions may accumulate. As this benign process continues, smooth, clear, white or yellow, rounded elevations may form and are visible during routine examination. Nabothian cysts typically do not warrant therapy. However, i they grow large enough to make cervical examination or PAP testing difficult or cause symptoms, they can be opened with a biopsy forceps drained. Moreover, i the diagnosis o a cervical mass is uncertain, biopsy or histologic con rmation is obtained.

questions.text: A 40 year old presented to OPD with complaint of heavy menstrual bleeding,USG Pelvic organ was done showing ET 16mm This procedure was planned, identify the procedure?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Endometrial biopsy In women with AUB, sampling and histologic evaluation of the endometrium may identify infection or neo- plastic lesions such as endometrial hyperplasia or cancer.

questions.text: Case scenario – A 30 year old female with primary infertility presented to your OPD with complaint of Menorrhagia & dysmenorrhea with USG showing a cystic lesion of around8 * 7*5.3 cm with homogeneous, low-level internal echoes with typical ground glass echogenicity, CA 125 Levels were 159 , on p/v examination uterus was retroverted , non mobile, tenderness was present . What would be your diagnosis
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Endometriosis Common in reproductive Age female & rarely occur in post menopausal female or adolescents Patient typically present with dysmenorrhea menorrhagia & infetility Usg reveal an adenexal mass with ground glass echogenicity CA 125 levels are more than 100 On examination POD tenderness present uterus is generally retroverted & non mobile due to adhesions

questions.text: What is the investigation of choice for the condition mentioned bellow: Case scenario – A 30 year old female with primary infertility presented to your OPD with complaint of Menorrhagia & dysmenorrhea with USG showing a cystic lesion of around8 * 7*5.3 cm with homogeneous, low-level internal echoes with typical ground glass echogenicity, CA 125 Levels were 159 , on p/v examination uterus was retroverted , non mobile, tenderness was present . What would be your diagnosis
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Diagnostic laparoscopy along with biopsy of implants is investigation of choice in this case which helps in visualisation inspection as well as staging of disease.

questions.text: Patient with the above condition was operated and this was intraoperatively findings , what will you advice her for management of infertility ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Image showing chocolate cyst which comes under severe type of endometriosis so best plan of management to treat infertility is to go for IVF ? If patient present with mild or minimal type of endometriosis with infertility – management is to go for superovulation with clomifene citrate with IUI

questions.text: The following condition is most commonly seen in ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Most commonly seen in Ovary > POD > post leaf of broad ligament > uterosacral ligament > Fallopian tube

questions.text: The appearance of cervical mucous shown in image will appear on
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) image showing Ferning of cervical mucous appear on day 8 of cycle and disappear on day 18 of cycle.

questions.text: A 39 year old obese female came with complaint of irregular vaginal bleeding , what will be the best diagnostic midality for her management
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Hysteroscopy identi es nearly all cases of endometrial polyps Another advantage of hysteroscopy is the ability to identify and remove the polyp concurrently.

questions.text: A girl presented with hirsutism, Acne, hoarseness if voice and sudden increase in body weight Usg findings reveal 10-12 follicles in ovary with increase ovarian volume Which statement will be correct of disease in question.
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Patient have PCOS – poly cystic ovarian disease Features are : ? menstrual dysfunction may range rom amenorrhea to oligomenorrhea to episodic menometrorrhagia ? Hyperandrogenism- manifested clinically by hirsutism, acne, and/or androgenic alopecia. ? Acanthosis Nigricans. This skin condition is characterized by thickened, gray-brown velvety plaques seen in Flexures areas such as the back of the neck, axillae, inframammary creases, waist, and groin ? Impaired Glucose Tolerance and Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus. ? LH/FSH levels > 2:1 ? Estrogen level increases, total E2 remains normal ? SHBG level decreases

questions.text: In a patient of infertility endometrial biopsy was done in premenstrual phase, on histopathological examination following findings were obtained, what does it indicate ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (E) Biopsy shows proloferative phase with ? Tall elongated glands ? Pseudostratification ? Telescoping of endometrial glands ? Occurs under effect of estrogen

questions.text: A 14 year old girl presented with primary infertility, on examination we could see a bulging membrane, what is the origin mucus membrane visible in the image ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Image showing a case of imperforate hymen ? It is most common obstructive congenital lesion of female genital tract ? Hymen is a thin endodermal mucous membrane present at sinovaginal bulb with urogenital sinus ? Patient present with primary infertility

questions.text: Image showing a sex differentiation disorder in a obese women with complaint of hirsudism with body weight 98kg and height 130 cm, 17 hydroxyprogestrone levels were done in her and value was 400 ng/dl, what would be your next step?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) ? This shows – woman with virilization manifest by clitoromegaly seen in Non- Classical CAH Or Late-onset form of CAH, the enzyme deficiency leads to a relative cortisol deficiency ? With late-onset CAH, the most commonly affected enzyme is 21-hydroxylase, and deficiency leads to accumula- tion o its substrate, 17-hydroxyprogesterone. ? Serum values are drawn in the morning rom a asting patient. T reshold values o 17-hydroxyprogesterone that measure > 200 ng/dL should prompt an ACTH stimulation test. With this test, syn- thetic ACTH, 250 ?g, is injected intravenously, and a serum 17-hydroxyprogesterone level is measured 1 hour later. ? serum levels o 17-hydroxyprogesterone can reach many times their normal concentrations. Levels > 1000 ng/dL rom blood drawn a ter synthetic AC H is given are indicative of late-onset CAH.

questions.text: Sample was collected from a female for vaginal maturation index & Photomicrograh of cytology of specimen shows following finding, it can indicate all except
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Maturation index provides insight into cytohormonal status of the patient and is based on a count of parabasal, intermediate, and superficial (P:I:S) cells. Here it indicates- more intermediate cells – Mostly due to effect of Progestrone Seen in ? Luteal phase of menstrual cycle ? Pregnancy ? Women in Early menopausal transition ? Primenarch Girl

questions.text: Identify the type of prolapse seen in image
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Pelvic organ prolapse is descent of the anterior vaginal wall, posterior vaginal wall, uterus (cervix), the vaginal apex ? terms cystocele, cystourethrocele, uterine prolapse, uter- ine procidentia, rectocele, and enterocele have traditionally been used to describe the structures behind the vaginal wall thought to be prolapse ? Likewise in the image below it shows Anterior vaginal wall prolapse or cystocele

choices.text: Vaginal packing followed by ring pessary

questions.text: A 76 year old menopausal , P4L4 presented to Gynae OPD with Complaint of something coming out of vagina since last 3 years , patient is known case of diabetes since last 16 years on treatment, she is also taking treatment for hypertension since last 10 years With 2D Echo showing ejection fraction of 44% On examination you see finding shown in image, what would be plan of management for the patient
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Image showing 4th degree uterovaginal prolapse with decubitus ulcer Best line of management in this patient would be – Vaginal packing followed by ring pessary considering the co-morbidities

questions.text: A lady presented with complain of post coital bleeding and continuous vaginal discharge since last 1-2 years, on examination cervix showed a growth, after complete work up biopsy was planned & report showed following findings, what will be your diagnosis
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) ? Image of HPE report showing high-grade SIL showing dis- ordered, highly atypical squamous cells and increased mitotic activity involving the full thickness of the epithelium. ? severity of a squamous intraepithelial lesion is graded by the proportion o epithelium with abnormal cells from the basement membrane upward toward the surface. ? In the case of cervical intraepithelial neoplasia (CIN), abnormal cells confined to the lower third of the squamous epithelium are referred to as mild dysplasia or CIN 1 ? extending into the middle third as moderate dyspla- sia or CIN 2, into the upper third as severe dysplasia or CIN 3, and full-thickness involvement as carcinoma in situ (CIS)

questions.text: Chose the correct option
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) 1- Ayer’s Spatula - spatula predominantly samples the ectocervix 2- Endocervix brush or cytobrush samples the endocervical canal and is used in combination with a spatula. 3- broom samples both endo- and ectocervical epithelia simul- taneously

questions.text: Which stage of CA cervix is shown in image
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) In stage III carcinoma has extended to the pelvic wall; on rectal examination there is no cancer free space between tumorand pelvic wall;tumorinvolves lowerthird of vagina;all cases with hydronephrosis or nonfunctioning kidney should be included, unless they are known to be due to another cause III A No extension to pelvic wall, but involvement of lower third of vagina IIIB Extension to pelvic wall, or hydronephrosis or nonfunctioning kidney due to tumor

questions.text: A lady underwent endometrial biopsy due to AUB ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) ? High power view of normal proliferative endometrium shows regularly spaced glands composed of stratified columned epithelium with bland, slightly elongate nuclei. ? . In simple hyperplasia, glands are modestly crowded and typically display normal tubular shape or mild gland-shape abnormalities. Nuclei are bland. ? In this case of simple hyperplasia with atypia, glands are only mildly crowded. Occasional glands show nuclear atypia characterized by nuclear rounding and visible nucleoli. ? In complex hyperplasia, glands are more markedly crowded. Some specimens show architectural abnormalities such as papillary infoldings, although the gland profiles in this case are fairly regular. ? In complex hyperplasia with atypia, glands are markedly crowded and some have papillary infoldings. Nuclei show variable atypia.

questions.text: Identify the Tanner stage shown in the image
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) ? In tanner 1 -no palpable breast tissue ? In tanner 2 – breast budding occurs with visible palpable breast tissue ? In tanner 3- further growth & elevation of entire breast ? In tanner 4 – projection of areola & papillae above the breast ? In tanner 5 – complete mature breast

questions.text: Hystosalphingography image of a lady presented with secondary infertility with complaint of menstrual irregularity since last 7-8 months, what would be your diagnosis ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Image showing HSG of Genital TB with cobble stone appearance of Fallopian tube Bilateral hydrosalphix, Tobacoo pouch appearance with peritubal halo

questions.text: HSG image shows following finding in a patient with distance A measuring less than 4 cm & angle B measuring less than 60 degree what would be your diagnosis ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) ? Most common müllerian anomaly is Septate Uterus ? Combined hysteroscopy and laparoscopy help to differen- tiate between bicornuate uterus and septate uterus. ? The presence of the uterine fundus suggests a septate uterus. ? Ultrasonography—septate uterus appears as two cavities without sagittal notching and the intercornual distance is less than 4.0 cm. Diagnosis of bicornuate uterus is favoured, if the fundal midpoint indentation is more than 5 mm above the inter-ostial line. ? Hysterosalpingography (HSG)— If the angle of divergence between the two uterine cavities is less then 75°, the defect is most likely to be septate uterus. If the angle of divergence is more then 75° but less then 105° a diagnosis of bicornuate uterus is made . ? Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI)—it is an accurate and noninvasive investigation to make a diagnosis of septate uterus. If the septum extends to more the. 30% of the septal cav- ity, surgical resection is indicated.

choices.text: Their nuclei contain no nuclear satellite body and no drumsticks in the neutrophils.
In this disease germ cells fail to migrate to the genital ridge from the yolk sac
Pregnancy can occur with the donor egg

questions.text: A young girl presented with primary amenorrhea, on examination secondary sexual characters are absent with FSH > 40mIU/mL and E2 is below 25 pg/m, what would be the incorrect statement for the disease
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Image shows a patient with Turner’s Syndrome ? In this syndrome, either the short arm of X chromosome is deleted or the nucleus possesses only 45 chromosomes, ? their nuclei contain no nuclear satellite body and no drumsticks in the neutrophils. ? Turner’s syndrome has also been called ovarian agenesis or gonadal dysgenesis because at laparotomy the gonad is found to consist of undifferentiated stroma with absence of sex cells, ? The patients are clinically of short stature though not actual dwarfs, the trunk is muscu- lar, the neck is short and webbed, cubitus valgus is notable. ? The breasts are not developed and pubic, and axillary hair is scanty or absent. ? shield chest, high palate, low-set ears, lymphoedema of the extremities at birth and deafness. ? Serum follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH) is above 40 mIU/mL and E2 is below 25 pg/mL ? A pregnancy can occur with the donor egg in IVF programme if the uterus is present. If few fol- licles persist after puberty, menstruation and pregnancy is possible (15%).

questions.text: Identify the condition ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) ? Chlamydia causes perihepatitis and Fitz-Hugh–Curtis syndrome similar to that of gonor- rhoea when PID is associated with right upper abdominal pain. ? Laparoscopy in gonococcal & chlamydia reveals, apart from tubal disease, a band of fibrous tissue on right side stretching from fallopian tube to the under surface of the liver (Fitz–Hugh Curtis syndrome)

questions.text: A young sexually active woman presented to you with acute abdominal pain associated with complaint of vaginal discharge, usg showed pelvic abscess, what is the procedure shown in image done in that patient
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Patient presented with acute PID with pelvic abscess, which is drained by posterior Colpotomy

questions.text: Instrument used in which surgery
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Image showing Bonney’s myomectomy clamp used in myomectomy

choices.text: Intense and prolonged monitoring not required.
Ovulation occurs in 80–90% and pregnancy in 60–70%.

questions.text: All are advantage of procedure shown in image is except
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Image showing laparoscopic ovarian drilling in patient of PCOS Advantages of surgery are as follows: • Tubal testing with chromotubation can be performed simultaneously. • Other causes of infertility, i.e. endometriosis looked for. • One-time treatment. • Intense and prolonged monitoring not required. • Cost effective compared to IVF. • Reduces androgen and LH production • Following surgery, single ovulation occurs with drugs, and hyperstimulation and multiple pregnancy are avoided. • Ovulation occurs in 80–90% and pregnancy in 60–70%.

questions.text: Tumor shown in image are commonly seen in ovaries but extraovarian origin of such tumor is all except
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Image showing Dermoid cyst of ovary ? A dermoid cyst is usually unilocular with smooth surface, seldom attaining more than 15 cm in diameter ? It contains sebaceous material and hair, and the wall is lined in part by squamous epithelium which contains hair follicles and sebaceous glands ? Extraovarian dermoid cysts arise occasionally in the lumbar region, uterovesical area, parasacral region and rectovaginal septum.

choices.text: They have smooth surfaces which may be slightly bossed; they are freely movable in the pelvis
These tumors are always primary growth in ovary
Histologically, the tumour has a cellular or myxomatous stroma amongst which are scattered large signet-ring cells

questions.text: True statement about ovarian tumor shown in image are all except
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Image showing Krukenberg Tumour if ovary ? Krukenberg tumours are almost bilateral. ? They have smooth surfaces which may be slightly bossed; they are freely movable in the pelvis ? There is no tendency to form adhesions with neighbouring viscera and there is no infiltration through the capsule. ? Histologically, the tumour has a cellular or myxomatous stroma amongst which are scattered large signet-ring cells. ? These cells are ovoid in shape with a granular cytoplasm and the nucleus is compressed against one pole of the cell so that the outline of the cell resembles a signet ring. ? The tumours are secondary growth in the ovary and most often arise from a primary carcinoma of the stomach (70%), large bowel (15%) and breast (6%). ? The tumours almost certainly arise by retrograde lymphatic spread

choices.text: Sim’s speculum – to retract posterior vaginal wall
Sim’s anterior vaginal wall retractor -to retract anterior vaginal wall
Auvard speculum used retracts the posterior vaginal wall during vaginal hysterectomy

questions.text: Identify the instrument & its use
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Auvard speculum is a heavy retractor provided with a heavy metal ball and is self-retaining. It is employed in vaginal hysterectomy to retract the posterior vaginal wall. A channel is provided in the handle to collect the blood and drain.

questions.text: All Are Contraindications For Use Of Instrument Except ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) The Leech-Wilkinson Intra-Uterine Cannula used in hysterosalpingography ? It uses 10 ml of water soluble dye Contraindications are ? Pregnancy ? Active bleeding ? Current pelvic infection ? Tb of genital organs as it leads to further spread of infection ? Contrast allergy

questions.text: A 42 yr old female presented withdomplaint of heavy menstrual bleeding since 1 year, no history of any intermentrual or post coital bleeding, current menstrual formula is 5-6 /20-24 days with 5-6 pads/day.on examination Per speculum cervix normal looking,vaginal rugae seen,old blood on vaginal walls Per Vaginal examination -cervix downward, uterus anteverted 10-12 weeks size, firm, mobile, regular, nontender, fornices clear She bought an Usg showing image below, what would be your diagnosis
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Image showing The Venetian blinda.k.a. rain shower appearance is a sonographic finding that is typically associated with adenomyosis but can also occur in uterine fibroids. The Venetian blind appearance associated with adenomyosis is typically "thin" whereas when associated with uterine fibroids, there are also edge shadows or dense posterior shadowing from calcification Here as we correlate with history diagnosis is Adenomyosis

choices.text: Biopsy is taken from pale mucosal areas or acetowhite areas
Green filter is used to identify blood vessels

questions.text: A lady presented in your OPD with abnormal PAP smear report you decide to take a biopsy using this instrument, all are correct statement for the instrument except
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Image showing colposcope directed biopsy ? It’s an instrument with inbuilt microscope to examine cervix ? Max magnification is 30X ? Focal length of microscope – 30 cm ? Biopsy specimen taken from irregular mucosa, & acetowhite areas ? With green filter – red blood vessels & neovascularisation is easily picked up

questions.text: A 55 year old obese female who is a smoker presented with an abdominal mass since last 6 months, CA- 125 was done having value was 68, oophotectomy was done & HPE examination shows following findings, what would be your diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Brenner tumor of the ovary is a solid, abnormal growth (tumor) on the ovary, mostly benign. These tumors most often occur in women after menopause. The diagnosis is made by microscopic examination of a piece of tumor obtained by a surgical biopsy Microscopic findings are – ? Typical presentation is walthard cell nest ? Solid and cystic nests of urothelium-like cells surrounded by abundant dense, fibrous stroma ? Epithelial cells have sharp outlines ? Cells are uniform, polygonal with pale cytoplasm, small but distinct nucleoli, often grooved nuclei (similar to granulosa cell tumors) – coffee bean nuclei ? Frequent microcysts within epithelial

questions.text: During Laprotomy in view of ovarian mass a solid, pink to tan to cream-colored lobulated masses was removed measuring around 15 to 12 cm Histopath examination showed monotonous proliferation of large, rounded, polyhedral clear cells that are rich in cytoplasmic glycogen and contain uniform central nuclei with one or a Few prominent nucleoli. The tumor cells closely resem- ble the primordial germ cells of the embryo and are histologically identical to seminoma of testis. What would be tumor marker correlation in this patient
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Ovarian Tumor in image is Dysgerminoma Tumor marker – dysgerminoma - LDH & hCg Endodermal Sinus Tumor – alpha feto protein, never secreate hCg Embryonal cancer – alpha fetoprotein & hCg Chiriocarcinoma – hCg

Sonography is more sensitive and specific then this procedure

Normal-appearing perito- neal Fluid is designated as a negative test ? Fragments of an old clot or nonclotting blood are found in the aspirate when placed into a dry, clean test tube, then hemoperitoneum is diagnosed ? Sonography with ndings o echogenic uid to establish hemoperitoneum ismore sensitive and specifc than culdocentesis

questions.solution: Correct Answer (A)

questions.text: Blood supply of part mentioned in image is
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Blood supply to middle part of vulva is by internal pudental artery which is branch of internal illiac artery Blood supply to fore part of vulva is by deep & superficial pudental arteries which are branch of femoral artery

questions.text: Picture showing sacrocolpopexy in a 82 year old female with history of abdominal hysterectomy 5 years back, identify the structure A
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) In sacrocolpopexy done for vault repair, mesh is connected to anterior longitudinal ligament

questions.text: A gynaecologist gave a transverse incision over abdomen before starting radical hysterectomy , to avoid tearing of vessels “V” in image she decides to ligate it, identify the vessels
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) ? Once the transverse fascia incision has been carried lateral to the borders of the rectus muscles, the inferior epigastric vessels, lying on the posterolateral border of each muscle ? The vessels are “teased” away from their attachments by using blunt dissection with an instrument or gentle finger dissection. The vessels are ligated before incising the rectus muscles to avoid tearing of the vessels, vessel retraction, and hematoma formation

questions.text: Histopathology examination of ovarian mass shows reticular pattern, with extraembryonic differentiation, with the formation of a network of irregular anastomosing spaces that are lined by primitive epithelial cells, patient also had elevated Alpha feto protein levels, identify the type of ovarian Tumor
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) yolk sac Tumor ? Grossly, these tumors form solid masses that are more yel- low and riable than dysgerminomas. They are o ten focally necrotic and hemorrhagic, with cystic degeneration and rup- ture. ? T he microscopic appearance o yolk sac tumors is o ten diverse. most common appearance, the reticular pattern, refects extraembryonic dif erentiation, with the formation o a network o irregular anastomosing spaces that are lined by primitive epithelial cells. Schiller-Duval bodies are pathogno- monic when present ? Alpha- fetoprotein is commonly produced.

questions.text: An incidental ovarian mass is found when evaluating a 19-year-old girl for kidney stones. The mass is removed and its contents are shown below. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Mature teratoma The likely diagnosis in this patient with an asymptomatic ovarian mass consisting hair, bone, and sebaceous material is a mature teratoma.

questions.text: A lady on fertility evaluation shows the following hsg finding. All the following are correct about her diagnosis except
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Estrogen level is decreased Hormone Levels in Asherman Syndrome • Estrogen (E2): Usually normal • Progesterone: Normal. • FSH & LH: Typically normal; • AMH: Usually normal unless ovarian reserve is affected. • Causes: Mostly due to uterine trauma from procedures like dilation and curettage (D&C), infections, or C-sections. • Symptoms: Light or absent periods (amenorrhea) and hypomenorrhea. Infertility or recurrent miscarriages, Pelvic pain or discomfort • Diagnosis: Hysteroscopy (gold standard), Sonohysterography (saline ultrasound) Hysterosalpingography (HSG) • Treatment: Hysteroscopic surgery to remove adhesions

questions.text: A 40-year-old female presented with a history of profuse vaginal discharge with a fishy odor. On examination, there was no discharge from the cervix. Microscopy reveals the cell shown in the image. What is the probable diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Bacterial vaginosis The given image shows a clue cell – an epithelial cell with a fuzzy border due to adherence of bacteria. This along with the given clinical features suggests bacterial vaginosis. Diagnosis: Amsel criteria (3 out of 4 signs): 1. Thin, homogenous discharge 2. Vaginal pH >4.5 3. Positive whiff test (fishy odor with KOH) 4. Presence of clue cells on microscopy Nugent score (microscopic evaluation of bacterial flora)

questions.text: 36 year old lady with presents with progressive dysmenorrheal and lower abdominal pain. The following image is obtained in laparoscopy what is the diagnosis
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Endometriosis This is a chocolate cyst. ovarian cyst filled with old, dark brown blood, associated with endometriosis. • Cause: Endometrial tissue grows on the ovaries, forming blood-filled cysts. Repeated bleeding during menstrual cycles leads to cyst formation. • Symptoms: • Chronic pelvic pain (worse during periods) • Pain during intercourse (dyspareunia) • Irregular or heavy periods • Infertility (common in severe cases) • Diagnosis:Ultrasound (shows a homogenous, ground-glass appearance), MRI (for detailed imaging if needed) CA-125 blood test (may be elevated but not specific) • Treatment: Medication: Hormonal therapy (birth control pills, GnRH agonists) to suppress growth. Surgery: Laparoscopic removal (preferred for large or symptomatic cysts). Ovarian cystectomy

questions.text: 50 year old woman undergoes hysterectomy for progressive dysmenorrhea and menorrhagia. Specimen is shown above what is diagnosis
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Adenomyosis Adenomyosis Definition: Endometrial tissue grows into the uterine muscle, causing an enlarged uterus and pain. Symptoms: Heavy periods, severe cramps, pelvic pain, enlarged tender uterus, pain during sex. Diagnosis: Ultrasound(ioc) , MRI(gold standard) Treatment: NSAIDs, hormonal therapy (birth control, IUD), hysterectomy for severe cases. Complications: Anemia, chronic pain, possible infertility

questions.text: Which is not a contraindication of above device
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Coagulation disorder This is mirena, lng containing IUD. Contraindications for Mirena (Levonorgestrel IUD) • Pregnancy or suspected pregnancy • Unexplained vaginal bleeding • Active pelvic inflammatory disease (PID) or recurrent PID • Untreated genital infections (e.g., cervicitis, endometritis) • Uterine abnormalities (fibroids, congenital defects) that distort the cavity • Current or history of breast cancer • Acute liver disease or liver tumors • Known or suspected uterine or cervical malignancy • Recent postpartum endometritis or infected abortio

questions.text: Laparoscopic ovarian drilling is done for
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) PCOS This is laparoscopic ovarian drilling • A minimally invasive surgical procedure used to induce ovulation in women with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS) who are resistant to medications like letrozole/clomiphene citrate. • Indications: PCOS with anovulation, Failure to respond to fertility medications • Procedure: Performed via laparoscopy under general anesthesia. Small holes (drilling) are made in the ovarian cortex using electrocautery or laser , reduce androgen-producing tissue. • Advantages: One-time procedure vs. long-term medication use. No risk of ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome (OHSS) like in gonadotropin therapy • Risks/Complications: Ovarian damage or reduced ovarian reserve (if excessive drilling is done), Infection, bleeding, adhesions • Success Rate: 80% ovulation rate, 50-60% pregnancy rate within a year

questions.text: A 24-year-old sexually active female presents with vaginal discharge and itching. On examination, there is erythema and a curd-like discharge. What is the most likely causative organism?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Candida albicans Candida albicans is a common cause of vaginal yeast infections, characterized by itching, erythema, and a curd-like discharge. It is often seen in sexually active women, and the overgrowth of yeast can be triggered by factors such as antibiotics or hormonal changes.

questions.text: A 26-year-old woman is evaluated for primary infertility. Hysterosalpingography was done and reveals the finding shown below. What is the anomaly seen in the image?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Septate uterus The anomaly seen in the given hysterosalpingogram is suggestive of a septate uterus. A septate uterus is characterized by the presence of a septum in the endometrial cavity due to the failure of the medial segments of the Müllerian ducts to regress. This creates a permanent septum within the uterine cavity. The septum can project partially from the fundus or can extend completely to the cervical os. On HSG, the septate uterus is seen as widely diverging horns with an intercornual angle <75 degrees.

questions.text: Which hormone is depicted by blue graph
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Estrogen Estrogen shows a peak before ovulation which causes LH surge and after ovulation it is also produced by corpus luteum. Green line represents progesterone produced by corpus luteum

questions.text: Which if the following is not a presentation of clinical condition shown above
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Absent secondary sexual characters This is imperforate hymen • Symptoms: • Primary amenorrhea (no periods) with secondary sexual characters • Cyclic pelvic pain • Swelling of the lower abdomen • Difficulty or inability to urinate (in some cases) • Bulging bluish membrane at the vaginal opening • Diagnosis: Physical examination- bluish bulging membrane , Ultrasound (to confirm retained menstrual blood) • Complications: Hematocolpos (accumulation of menstrual blood in the vagina), Hematometra (blood buildup in the uterus), Infertility if untreated Treatment – cruciate incision

questions.text: Staging laparotomy was performed in a teenage girl who presented with an adnexal mass. Histopathological examination showed the following. What is the diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Endodermal sinus tumor The given histopathological image shows Schiller-Duval bodies. It is suggestive of a yolk sac tumor (endodermal sinus tumor). It is an aggressive malignant germ cell tumor of the ovaries. It occurs in ovaries or testes and sacrococcygeal areas in young children. It is usually unilateral. These tumors are usually associated with raised AFP and alpha 1 antitrypsin

choices.text: It should be changed every 3 months
It can be used in pregnant patients
It may rarely cause carcinoma of vagina

questions.text: The given instrument was used to treat a patient with uterine prolapse. Which of the following statements is false about this instrument?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) It is curative The given image shows a ring pessary, which is only a palliative treatment for genital prolapse. A ring pessary is used for patients who cannot be surgically managed, such as pregnant patients and very elderly women. In these patients, it is used as an adjunct to pelvic floor physiotherapy.

questions.text: In which phase of the menstrual cycle will you this characteristic appearance of the endometrium
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Late follicular Trilaminar Endometrium – Definition: A distinct three-layered appearance of the endometrium seen on ultrasound, typically during the late follicular phase of the menstrual cycle. Structure: Outer echogenic layer (basal layer), Middle hypoechoic layer (functional layer), Inner echogenic line (endometrial stripe) Significance: Indicates optimal endometrial receptivity for embryo implantation in fertility treatments. Commonly observed before ovulation when estrogen levels peak. Clinical Importance: Favorable for implantation in assisted reproductive techniques (ART). Thin or absent trilaminar pattern may indicate poor endometrial receptivity.

questions.text: Which surgery would you recommend for the above patient
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Posterior colpoperineorrhaphy Sims speculum is retracting the anterior vaginal wall, the bulge is seen but I is not uterus as cervical opening is not seen so the bulge is from posterior wall which is recrocele.

questions.text: Air dried sample of cervical mucus shows this under effect of high amount of
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Estrogen • A microscopic fern-like pattern seen in dried cervical mucus due to the presence of sodium and estrogen. • Cause: High estrogen levels during the ovulatory phase cause increased salt and water content in the mucus, leading to crystallization. • Significance: Predicts ovulation: Best seen around mid-cycle

questions.text: The following is hysteroscopic image of woman who had heavy bleeding for 6 months. What is the FIGO classification
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Type 0 The International Federation of Gynecology and Obstetrics (FIGO) system classifies fibroids based on their location within the uterus: Intramural Fibroids (Within the Uterine Wall) Type 3: Contacts the endometrium but does not distort the uterine cavity. Type 4: Completely within the myometrium (most common type). Submucosal Fibroids (Distort the Endometrial Cavity) Type 0: Completely intracavitary, attached by a stalk. Type 1: >50% within the endometrial cavity, but partially in the myometrium. Type 2: <50% in the cavity, mostly in the myometrium. Subserosal Fibroids (Projecting from the Outer Uterine Surface) Type 5: Mostly intramural, but extends to the serosal surface. Type 6: Predominantly subserosal, but with some myometrial involvement. Type 7: Completely subserosal, attached to the uterus by a stalk (pedunculated).

questions.text: A 28-year-old nulligravida presents with severe dysmenorrhea, chronic pelvic pain, and dyspareunia. Physical examination reveals tender nodules on the posterior fornix and uterosacral ligaments. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Endometriosis. Endometriosis is a chronic gynecological condition characterized by the presence of endometrial-like tissue outside the uterus, often on the pelvic peritoneum, ovaries, and other pelvic structures. The classic symptoms include dysmenorrhea (painful periods), chronic pelvic pain, and dyspareunia (pain during sexual intercourse). On pelvic examination, tender nodules or masses may be palpable, particularly on the posterior fornix and uterosacral ligaments.

questions.text: A young woman visits a gynecologist due to intense itching in the vulva and a foul-smelling, thin, green vaginal discharge. Upon examining the cervix, specific findings are noted. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Trichomoniasis The symptoms of severe vulvar itching and a foul-smelling, thin, green discharge are indicative of trichomoniasis, a sexually transmitted infection caused by the parasite Trichomonas vaginalis.

questions.text: A lady has undergone the test shown above in the image. What could be her presentation?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Hysterosalpingography (HSG) is a radiologic procedure used to evaluate the uterine cavity and patency of the fallopian tubes. It is most commonly performed in women who present with infertility, as it helps identify conditions such as tubal blockage, uterine anomalies, or intrauterine adhesions that may interfere with conception. A. Heavy bleeding is incorrect because HSG is not typically done for evaluating heavy menstrual bleeding. While uterine abnormalities that cause heavy bleeding might be visualized, it is not the main indication. B. Dysmenorrhea is incorrect because HSG is not the primary investigation for painful menstruation. Conditions like endometriosis or adenomyosis are better assessed with ultrasound or MRI. D. Vaginal discharge is incorrect because HSG is not done to evaluate infections or discharge. In fact, active vaginal or pelvic infection is a contraindication for the procedure.
